bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 166, Number 63 (Tuesday, March 31, 2020)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. CRAIG:H.R. 6420.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, Clause 1 of the Constitution[Page H1872]

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

item.latestTitle: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide for dependents to be taken into account in determining the amount of the 2020 recovery rebates.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

item.fullName: Rep. Sablan, Gregorio Kilili Camacho [D-MP-At Large]
Rep. San Nicolas, Michael F. Q. [D-GU-At Large]

item.name: Emergency medical services and trauma care

item.text:
All Dependent Children Count Act

This bill extends the 2020 recovery rebates of the Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security Act to all taxpayer dependents.
item.name: Introduced in House

bill.title: All Dependent Children Count Act

item.title: To allow 2020 recovery rebates with respect to qualifying children over the age of 16.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
